intro: Cephaloseris poeppigii, commonly known as the rock dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and fibrous root system. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, thriving in arid and coastal environments. Its flowers are yellow and dandelion-like, with a distinctive central disk surrounded by ray florets. Cephaloseris poeppigii is often found in open habitats, such as cliffs and slopes, where it contributes to the local biodiversity.
